item.title: Contact
item.description: If you find something I’ve made interesting or want to colaborate in some way, feel free to reach out via E-mail rnukoj@gmail.com or LinkedIn.

item.title: About
item.description: My name is Rasmus Nuko JÃ¸rgensen and I’m based in Denmark. I graduated a B.Sc. in Computer Science from The University of Southern Denmark Odense in 2022. I’m currently persuing a Masters degree in Sound and Music Computing at Aalborg University in Copenhagen (2022-2024). I went with Sound and Music Computing, as it combines two of my interests: Sound and Computing. My musical experience consists of fooling around in Ableton, and not of any traditional training / music education.

item.title: PhISM Percussion Synth
item.description: Intention Link to heading This blog post will show the development process of a percussive real time synth. Prior research Link to heading After telling my supervisors I wanted to build a percussive NIME, one of them suggested I looked at the article Physically Informed Sonic Modeling (PhISM): Synthesis of Percussive Sounds by Perry Cook from 1997. One-pager containing initial first sketch of NIME and answers to some guiding quetions can be seen in this PDF document.
